body:
Comment 1: 
"In other words, the usage of unqualified identifiers in expressions is not mentioned at
all (apart from the brackets in QualifiedIdent rule)."

That is right.

However, there does not seem to be a better alternative to the name QualifiedIdent. In
other words, if you were designing the grammar yourself it is very likely that you would
also choose the name QualifiedIdent.

The name QualifiedIdent matches the naming convention used in other parts of the spec.
For example: FunctionDecl (http://golang.org/ref/spec#FunctionDecl) is in fact a
function declaration (without the body) and what some people would would call function
definition (with the body). Another example: UnaryExpr
(http://golang.org/ref/spec#Operators) does not necessarily need to be an unary operator
followed by an expression. In formal grammar definitions, this style is the norm.

QualifiedIdent will make sense if you look at the grammar from the perspective of
UnaryExpr.

I believe we can close this issue.
